issue.title: cppcheck errors: constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit

content.raw:
I wouldn't say that there is 'a right thing to do'. Depending on what we are looking for when defining the constructor we can choose one way or the other.

I think that what we are discussing here is what c++ called a "converting constructor" I found it well explained in the [cppreference](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/converting_constructor) page. 

About the pros vs cons, [this programmers Q&A](http://programmers.stackexchange.com/a/190734) answers can help.
